verbose_text: Such adaptive change is even significant in the OASL subfamily, where the non enzymatic hOASL mediates RIG-I activation to inhibit virus replication by mimicking polyubiquitin and upregulating the expression of IFNbeta, TNFalpha, and IL-8, whereas the ortholog of hOASL in mouse (the non enzymatic mOasl1) negatively regulates antiviral immunity by inhibiting the translation of IFN-regulatory factor 7 (IRF7).
evidence: OASL subfamily, where the non-enzymatic hOASL mediates RIG-I
